newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia to cut '97 domestic borrowing, raise foreign.
newsitem.headline: Russia to cut '97 domestic borrowing, raise foreign.

text.p: Russia will cut its domestic borrowing to 48.50 trillion roubles in 1997 from 56.10 trillion in 1996 but will increase its borrowing on international markets, a finance ministry expert said on Friday.

The 1997 draft budget provides for a deficit of 89.10 trillion roubles and Russia plans to borrow 40.60 trillion roubles on international markets, including loans from the International Monetary Fund, Arkady Dvorkovich told Reuters.
"The goal is to make investment in industry more attractive than investment in government securities," he said.
The 1997 draft budget is to be submitted to the State Duma lower house on August 31.
